div.l: And that a sly and vsant for to stele
His name was hote Deynous Symkyn
A wif he had com of noble kyn
The person of the toun hir fader was
With hir he yaf many a panne a bras
For that Symkyn shuld in his blood allie
She was fostered in a Nonnerie
For Symkyn nolde no wif as he seide
But she were wel norisshed ⁊and a maide
To saue his estat of yomanrie
And she was proude ⁊and pert as a pie
A ful faire siȝt was it vpon hem tuo
On holidaies before hir wolde he go
With his tipet wounde aboute his hed
And she cam aftir in a gite of red
And Symkyn had hosen of the same
Ther durst no wiȝt clepe hir but dame
Was non so hardi that went bi the way
That with hir durst rage or ellis pley
But if he wolde be slain of Symkyn
With panade knif or with boidekyn
For ielous folk ben perlous euermo
Algate thei wold her wifes wende so
And eke for she was somdel smoterlich
She was as deinous as water in a dissh
So full of hoker and of bismare
Hir thouȝt that a lady shuld hir spare
What for hir kinred and hir nortilry
That she had lerned in the Nonnery
A douȝter thei had betwen hem tuo
Of xxᵗⁱ yere withouten̄ any moo
Saf a childe that was of half yere age
In cradill it lay and was a propir page
This wenche thik and wel be growen̄ was
With camuse nose and yhen greie as glas
With buttokkes brode with brestis round ⁊and hye
But riȝt faire was hir here I wil nat lye
The person of the toun for she was faire
In purpos was to make hir his heir
Bothe of his catell and mesuage
And straunge he made it of hir mariage
His purpos was to bestowe hir hye
